content.description:
Pitch 1: Take the 5.8 Variation of Pete's Retreat which is located up and left of Wise Crack. Begin left of the corner. From the ground make a move up to a juggy ledge. Traverse the ledge almost to the corner then launch into the hand crack. Follow this up through blocky climbing then up a short face left of a big chimney. Step up and clip a bolt before making a somewhat committing move up and left to an arete. Follow the arete to a big ledge. Belay here on two bolts. Most would consider this pitch to be G but there is a slight run out before the bolt on easy terrain. 25 meters, 5.8 PG

 Pitch 2: From the belay ledge step right over the chimney, traversing under an overhanging wall on good holds and gear toward an overhanging crack leading up and right. Crank up through the crack then step left to a bolt protected slab. From this point there are two variations leading to a ledge and belay station 3 meters above the bolt. One variation goes out around the arete. Delicate footwork and thin holds lead up the arete with thrilling exposure. The other line goes straight up from the bolt through an overhang. Both lines are stunning with brilliant movement and exposure. Belay at the ledge on bolts. 15 meters 5.9 G

 Pitch 3: Step left, plug a bomber #1 camalot then pull out around the arete. Make a burly move up to a small ledge. Continue toward a bolt protected crux. Climb through the balancy crux up to a nice hand crack that leads to an offwidth. Move up the surprising pleasant offwidth then easy 5 th to the cheekbone anchor. 25 m 5.10- G.

 There are no rappel stations on the route so either rap Cheekbone Corner or take the 3rd class walk off down and left into the Amphitheater (fixed ropes here).

 This is a wildly exposed climb that requires good rope management and thoughtful gear placements to protect the second. It climbs best in three pitches. Pitch 1 and 2 can be combined.


Cheekbone Area

Single rack to 4" piece. Bolted belays. Bolts protect runout on all three pitches. Rap Cheekbone Corner.

This is a variation on the second pitch of Birdland. From the Pitch 1 belay, step right and make a huge reach to a decent hold. Pull a fun overhanging boulder problem past a couple bolts leading to lower angled rock and vertical cracks which lead to the pitch 2 anchor.
I highly recommend linking this into pitch 3 for an excellent long and varied pitch. (The regular pitch 2 can't be linked due to its wandery nature).

Starts from the pitch 1 anchor of Birdland
2 bolts, a few medium pieces. First bolt can be reached from the ledge so you are basically stick clipped for the crux.

climbs.name: Cheekbone Corner Direct
climbs.fa: C. Bell, G. Lacroix, F. Doucette

content.description:
This is the description for the more direct Cheekbone corner and not the original 5.5 three pitch route. Pitch 1. Near Cheekbone Boulder, scramble up to reach a large ledge and climb up the obvious off-width corner. After the corner keep going up the path of least resistance on blocky dirty terrain to get to a bolted anchor with chains 30' below the overhanging dihedral. 5.6 R 100' Pitch 2. Climb straight up the overhanging dihedral leading you to Pigeon shit ledge. From that ledge move left to an overhanging needle. Campus it to get around it (if you dare) and then climb straight up to reach trees at the top. 5.7 G 100' To descend, either walk down to the right or rap the route or from The Strata factor rap stations also on the right but closer to the face. Starts on a ledge 20' up from a huge fallen tree and a huge boulder in the middle of Cheekbone area. The Off-width corner is unmistakable The R off-width corner can be protected by slinging chock-stones. A Big-Bro might also work. PG gear after the corner.
Tree anchors

An excellent climb. Labeled as a sport climb but certainly not bolted like modern sport climbs. Expect big runouts, although the hard climbing is well protected. Bringing a small rack of small to medium cams is recommended.

P1: Pull off the ground and get established on a slab. Move up to a corner (gear available). Clip a very high second bolt on an overhang. Pull the small overhang then continue up the beautiful face and arête. Rap ring anchor. Mid sized gear also available before 4th bolt and after last bolt.

P2: Move left and engage a technical double-arête feature. Continue on easier terrain, savouring the wonderful exposure. Tree anchor.



Starts just right of where the ground is at its lowest point in front of Cheekbone Corner. Look for a bolt on a slab.

11 bolts total. small to medium cams.

From the ledge , climb into the vertical crack just right of the anchor. Step left and clip a bolt. Continue up discontinuous cracks to gain a rest in a large triangular cutout. Exit the cutout and move up and left to good holds before moving back right and loosely following the seam (very technical and exposed). Climb past the protruding block and top out on a ramp.

Variation (easier): After the big triangular cutout, move right and up towards a series of small ledges (one of the optional finishes for Strata Factor Direct). Run it out to the Strata Factor Direct anchors.


This is a second pitch, located on the impressive exposed face to the right of the 2nd pitch of Cheekbone Corner and to the left of the second pitch of Strata Factor Direct.

6 bolts. gear up to #1 c4. some doubles in finger sizes.

Fun way to get up on top of the buttress without leading the offwidth of Cheekbone.

Start left of Wise Crack on a dirt ledge near the bottom. Climb up easy stuff with great gear. Gets harder as you get near the top. This climb provides an easy way to the first belay/rap anchor of Cheekbone Corner
Standard rack to 1" piece. You could double up on small gear.

A great mixed climb that goes all the way up the wall. Excellent exposure on the second pitch.

P1: Climb the face past horizontals and bolts, aiming for a short bolted overhanging prow. Surmount the prow and gain a ledge. Step right into cracks and then back left to a bolted anchor on the face. 5.10c G, 30m 5 bolts

P2: Climb straight up and around a large block. Clip a bolt and move left into a finger crack. Follow bolts and mixed gear up the face. After the last bolt, either make a long diagonal traverse up and right along a crack then up to a bolted anchor or climb straight up from the bolt and trend right across the face on small ledges to the same anchor. 5.11b/c PG, 30m 4 bolts.


Starts on the face to the right of Cheekbone Corner.
Single rack, some bolts. bolted anchors.

Very fun climb. Scramble up easy terrain to a big ledge at the base of the gently overhanging wall. Climb the cracks to a bolted anchor.
This route climbs more like a sport route than your typical trad route. If it was longer, it would be a classic!

This route climbs the face left of the offwidth of Cheekbone Corner.
single rack up to BD .75. bolted anchor
Cheekbone is a traditional route area with multipitches and a few classic single pitch routes. Despite the traditional nature of the area, there are two classic 2 pitch bolted routes.
